Sentencas: The insufficient thermal mechanical stability of sealing interface presents a challenge for the development of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics

Sentencas: Here we report for the first time that the presence of gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) electrolyte leads to the formation of two hardystonite phases, (Ca(0.9)Z(0.03))(2)(Al0.63Zn0.37)(Si0.69Al0.31)(2)O-7 and Ca2ZnSi2O7, in the reaction couples between boroaluminosilicate sealing glass ceramics and GDC powders held at 700 degrees C for 30 days.
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics

Sentencas: Similarly, the aggregation of these two hardystonite phases also occurs at the interface between GDC and sealing glass ceramics under identical heat-treatment.
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics

Sentencas: In particular, (Ca(0.9)Z(0.03))(2)(Al0.63Zn0.37)(Si0.69Al0.31)(2)O-7 becomes the dominant phase at the sealing interface when the heat-treatment time increases from 7 days to 30 days.
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics

Sentencas: Moreover, the sealing interface remains intact after thermal cycles for 100 times, indicating the excellent thermal mechanical stability of hardystonite phases.
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics

Sentencas: Finally, the possible mechanism on the phase evolution of glass ceramic at the sealing interface has been proposed.
Titulo: Interaction between gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte and sealing glass-ceramics
